Situation1: A minor misunderstanding about weekend plans just arose.
Situation2: They must follow strict procedures for a large cash deposit at the end of a busy shift to comply with corporate auditing rules.
Story: I glanced at my phone, heart pounding as I read Mia’s text: “Can we talk? I thought we were spending Saturday together, but you made plans with your friends?” I could almost hear the hurt in her words. As her boyfriend, I knew I should call her right away, clear up the misunderstanding, and reassure her that she mattered most. But the clock on the wall glared at me—ten minutes until closing. My manager had just reminded me that tonight was my turn to handle the large cash deposit, and the procedure was strict: count, recount, fill out forms, lock everything up, no distractions. If I messed up, it could mean a write-up or worse. My phone buzzed again, Mia’s name lighting up the screen. I felt torn in two—my girlfriend needed me, but so did my job. My hands shook as I reached for the deposit bag, my mind racing between the rules I had to follow and the person I didn’t want to let down.
